metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16393 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Several buffer overflows when handling responses from a Gemsafe V1 Smartcard in gemsafe_get_cert_len in libopensc/pkcs15-gemsafeV1.c in OpenSC before 0.19.0-rc1 could be used by attackers able to supply crafted smartcards to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

opensc - 0.19.0-1build1
opensc-pkcs11 - 0.19.0-1build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opensc package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.19.0-1build1').
